content:
• Wednesday, March 21, 2012
  • INTU

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) -1.9% AH after announcing TurboTax unit sales rose 8% Y/Y from the start of...

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) -1.9% AH after announcing TurboTax unit sales rose 8% Y/Y from the start of tax season to March 17. 14% growth in TurboTax Web sales was partly offset by a 3% drop for TurboTax Desktop, and a 7% drop for TurboTax Free File. Intuit is also reiterating its full-year revenue guidance.  The report comes as rival H&R Block (NYSE:HRB) boasts it's gaining share in the digital tax filing market.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND +2.4%) has resumed trading after announcing its forebearance agreement with...

    Diamond Foods (DMND +2.4%) has resumed trading after announcing its forebearance agreement with creditors. Initially down on the news, shares are now up 1.3% AH, adding to the gains seen before the market's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 6 Comments
  • DQ

    Shares of Daqo New Energy (DQ -7.5%) were hit hard today after missing Q4 estimates as revenue...

    Shares of Daqo New Energy (DQ -7.5%) were hit hard today after missing Q4 estimates as revenue plummeted over 50% Y/Y. The company also announced a delay in the its phase 1 debottlenecking and hydrochlorination project by one year. Piper Jaffray downgraded the shares on the back of the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • SRPT

    AVI BioPharma (AVII) files a $100M mixed securities shelf. Shares -5% AH.

    AVI BioPharma (AVII) files a $100M mixed securities shelf. Shares -5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • RGR

    Sturm, Ruger (NYSE:RGR) reports strong Q1 bookings, topping 1M units and causing the company to...

    Sturm, Ruger (NYSE:RGR) reports strong Q1 bookings, topping 1M units and causing the company to temporarily suspend the acceptance of any new orders. The company expects to resume the normal acceptance of orders by the end of May. Shares +1.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 7 Comments
  • CMRE

    Costamare (NYSE:CMRE) -8.7% AH after becoming the latest shipper to announce a stock offering...

    Costamare (NYSE:CMRE) -8.7% AH after becoming the latest shipper to announce a stock offering (previously). The company plans to sell 7.5M shares, good for proceeds of $106.1M at current levels. It partly expects to use the proceeds for vessel acquisitions and other capital expenditures. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) -17.6% AH after announcing a stock offering involving an...

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) -17.6% AH after announcing a stock offering involving an undisclosed number of shares. FuelCell, which has been bleeding cash as it works to boost sales of its distributed power plants, only says it will use the proceeds for "growth capital and general corporate purposes." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND +2.8%) spiked just before the close thanks to a WSJ report claiming the...

    Diamond Foods (DMND +2.8%) spiked just before the close thanks to a WSJ report claiming the scandal-plagued snack vendor is talking with P-E firms about a PIPE investment. An i-bank recently hired by Diamond is said to have approached KKR and TPG about taking a minority stake in the company, which may need a cash infusion to avoid defaulting on its debt covenants. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • DFS

    More on Discover Financial (NYSE:DFS): FQ1 earnings beat on all counts with record earnings for...

    More on Discover Financial (NYSE:DFS): FQ1 earnings beat on all counts with record earnings for the quarter. Revenue grew by 6.3% Y/Y as card sales volume grew 7% from the prior year period to $25.6B. Shares +2.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • SCVL

    Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCVL): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $182M (+1.1% Y/Y)...

    Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCVL): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $182M (+1.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • SONC

    Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ2 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $115M (+1.4% Y/Y) in-line....

    Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ2 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $115M (+1.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • MLHR

    Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR): FQ3 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $400M (-3.6% Y/Y)...

    Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR): FQ3 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $400M (-3.6% Y/Y) misses by $9M. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • MDRX

    Allscripts (MDRX -1.3%) drifts lower after JP Morgan cut the shares to Neutral, citing a lack of...

    Allscripts (MDRX -1.3%) drifts lower after JP Morgan cut the shares to Neutral, citing a lack of growth catalysts or revenue drivers.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • ZNGA

    More on Zynga's (ZNGA +2.5%) acquisition of OMGPOP: AllThingsD reports the sale price is $180M +...

    More on Zynga's (ZNGA +2.5%) acquisition of OMGPOP: AllThingsD reports the sale price is $180M + $30M in employee retention payments, citing sources. An OMGPOP exec tells VentureBeat Draw Something now has 14.1M daily users and 24.5M installs. The game is generating $250K/day in revenue ($91M annual run rate). The CEO of analytics firm Flurry thinks Zynga got a steal. "[OMGPOP is] leaving $800 million on the table," he claims. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • SCHL

    Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) announces revisions to FQ3 results following an adverse tax ruling....

    Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) announces revisions to FQ3 results following an adverse tax ruling. Previously reported as -$0.10, the quarter's EPS is now $-0.33. Shares +3%, were up 5.5% before the announcement. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +5%) says it will stream a new, original series, Hemlock Grove, with 13 episodes...

    Netflix (NFLX +5%) says it will stream a new, original series, Hemlock Grove, with 13 episodes beginning in 2013, as it continues to expand its repertoire of original content and differentiate itself from the competition. By the middle of 2013, NFLX will have five original series for streaming, according to its chief content officer. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 6 Comments
  • NI

    NiSource (NI +1%) ticks up after KeyBanc ups the shares on valuation, citing catalysts that...

    NiSource (NI +1%) ticks up after KeyBanc ups the shares on valuation, citing catalysts that include a potential dividend increase, infrastructure opportunities in the Marcellus and Utica shale plays and an opportunity to modernize its transmission pipeline.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • XXIA

    Ixia (XXIA -1.4%) dips after Mizuho cut the shares to Neutral earlier today, citing uncertainty...

    Ixia (XXIA -1.4%) dips after Mizuho cut the shares to Neutral earlier today, citing uncertainty from the company's surprise CEO transition and questions surrounding execution.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • CRR

    Shares of Carbo Ceramics (CRR -6.5%) tumble after a class-action lawsuit is filed in New York...

    Shares of Carbo Ceramics (CRR -6.5%) tumble after a class-action lawsuit is filed in New York federal court alleging the company issued false and misleading statements relating to the Jan. 26 drop in share prices, when CRR revealed a 70% decline in proppant sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (PWRD -3.9%) slips after Nomura cut the shares to Neutral earlier today, citing...

    Perfect World (PWRD -3.9%) slips after Nomura cut the shares to Neutral earlier today, citing delays in its pipeline of new titles.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) confirms it's acquired social game developer OMGPOP, makers of the mobile...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) confirms it's acquired social game developer OMGPOP, makers of the mobile game Draw Something and over 35 additional social games. In the six weeks since Draw Something was launched, it's been downloaded over 35M times, the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 4 Comments
  • ARIA

    Oppenheimer agrees with Jefferies analysis of Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +2.4%), saying the...

    Oppenheimer agrees with Jefferies analysis of Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +2.4%), saying the stock should be bought on any Taltorvic-related weakness. The firm notes the drug accounts for just $1 of its price target, and Ponatinib is the main value driver for the stock. Additionally, Lazard, Cowen and Rodman & Renshaw reiterate buys as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (HAL -2.1%) and Schlumberger (SLB -1.9%) join oilfield services competitor Baker...

    Halliburton (HAL -2.1%) and Schlumberger (SLB -1.9%) join oilfield services competitor Baker Hughes (BHI -5.9%) in the red after the BHI profit warning. Morgan Stanley chips in, cutting HAL to  equalweight as the battle for market share threatens margins. OIH -2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • MSTR

    MicroStrategy (MSTR +5.7%) is started at Buy with a $160 price target at Think Equity, which...

    MicroStrategy (MSTR +5.7%) is started at Buy with a $160 price target at Think Equity, which believes MSTR's license business is likely to show accelerated growth over the next couple of years. But UBS is more cautious in its outlook, noting MSTR continues to spend "with little insight into how long they will continue to invest at this pace."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • AZPN

    Aspen Technology (AZPN +1.3%) moves up on positive comments out of Pacific Crest. The firm says...

    Aspen Technology (AZPN +1.3%) moves up on positive comments out of Pacific Crest. The firm says AZPN is seeing strong demand due to the competitive advantage of its chemical engineering expertise, which is enabling the company to land larger deals and expand further into emerging markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +2.2%) rallies after the company makes note of the improved Siri integration provided...

    Yelp (YELP +2.2%) rallies after the company makes note of the improved Siri integration provided for Yelp's content with Apple's recently-released iOS 5.1. Unlike the initial implementation of Yelp on Siri, the iOS 5.1 release allows users to access Yelp's review pages by tapping on the business listings turned up by Siri.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • LEE

    Lee Enterprises (LEE +4.5%) plans to introduce online subscription models in more markets to...

    Lee Enterprises (LEE +4.5%) plans to introduce online subscription models in more markets to boost its newspapers' revenue and sees Q2 revenue similar to or slightly better than Q1. LEE also says digital subscription programs at six newspapers had no adverse affect on digital ad revenue, and the number of unique visits continued to grow.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes' (BHI -5.5%) warning of falling profits from its pressure-pumping product line...

    Baker Hughes' (BHI -5.5%) warning of falling profits from its pressure-pumping product line slams shares of Gardner Denver (GDI -7.4%), a maker of air compressors and pumps and a key Baker Hughes client. GDI is reduced to Hold from Buy at BB&T due to the BHI report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • SCHL

    Scholastic Corp. (SCHL +5.5%) and Lions Gate (LGF +3.4%) are both higher today in anticipation...

    Scholastic Corp. (SCHL +5.5%) and Lions Gate (LGF +3.4%) are both higher today in anticipation of Friday's movie debut of "The Hunger Games." nationwide. Last week Scholastic said sales of the book trilogy had reached a high point for the quarter, but some investors fear that the feverish interest in the film may already be priced-in to both stocks.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • NMR

    Nomura Holdings (NMR -5.5%) was involved in an insider trading case connected to a 2010 share...

    Nomura Holdings (NMR -5.5%) was involved in an insider trading case connected to a 2010 share sale by Inpex, Bloomberg reports. Japan's securities regulator says Chuo Mitsui Asset Trust & Banking got non-public information from an employee of one of the lead underwriters on Inpex's offering; Nomura was one of the underwriters.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • CVX

    Good news or bad news? Chevron (CVX -1.1%) says that the oil that recently seeped from an...

    Good news or bad news? Chevron (CVX -1.1%) says that the oil that recently seeped from an offshore Brazilian field is chemically different than the oil from last November's spill that put the company in a heap of trouble.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +6.2%) has a press conference scheduled for 3:00 PM EST amid increasing speculation...

    Zynga (ZNGA +6.2%) has a press conference scheduled for 3:00 PM EST amid increasing speculation that the company has acquired OMGPOP - a move that would enable it to add smash hit Draw Something to its arsenal of games. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • RT

    Ruby Tuesday (RT +12%) pops on a Raymond James upgrade to Outperform ahead of its April 4...

    Ruby Tuesday (RT +12%) pops on a Raymond James upgrade to Outperform ahead of its April 4 report, citing recent cost reduction efforts and an improving comp outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX +3.9%) rallies after ThinkEquity lifts its PT to $43. The firm likes Oracle's...

    Mellanox (MLNX +3.9%) rallies after ThinkEquity lifts its PT to $43. The firm likes Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) upbeat earnings call remarks about its Engineered Systems business, which grew 139% Y/Y. Oracle took a 10.2% stake in Mellanox in 2010, and the latter's InfiniBand adapters are used in the former's Exadata and Exalogic systems. ThinkEquity also believes Intel's Romley launch bodes well for Mellanox.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • DISH

    Dish Network (DISH +2.4%) rises after the FCC unveils a rulemaking proposal that should pave the...

    Dish Network (DISH +2.4%) rises after the FCC unveils a rulemaking proposal that should pave the way for 4G services to be allowed on the company's 2GHz. spectrum, in spite of a recent waiver denial. The FCC is also proposing interoperability rules be established for spectrum blocks in the 700 MHz. band - a positive for smaller carriers such as LEAP, PCS, and USM, who have complained a lack of rules could prevent them from obtaining compatible devices. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • AMG

    Affiliated Managers (AMG +1.2%) gets a lift from postitive comments out of Citigroup this...

    Affiliated Managers (AMG +1.2%) gets a lift from postitive comments out of Citigroup this morning, saying its acquisition of Veritable could be the first in a series of transactions that could unlock significant shareholder value. The firm raises its price target to $129 from $120 and keeps a Buy rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • USG

    Stephens adds to the bounce in USG (USG +11.8%), upgrading the shares to Overweight after the...

    Stephens adds to the bounce in USG (USG +11.8%), upgrading the shares to Overweight after the company reported solid preliminary results for January and February. The firm also raises its price target to $22 from $17.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN +3.6%) is rallying, apparently on takeover speculation. The drug developer also...

    Dendreon (DNDN +3.6%) is rallying, apparently on takeover speculation. The drug developer also jumped last Tuesday on M&A rumors.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • MU

    Micron Technology (MU +3.2%) moves up after RBC Capital initiates the stock with an Outperform...

    Micron Technology (MU +3.2%) moves up after RBC Capital initiates the stock with an Outperform rating, saying they expect selling prices for computer memory chips to bottom this quarter. Pricing has been weak in recent months amid worries about an oversupply of chips and a slowdown in technology spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • SYNC

    Synacor (SYNC +16.3%) soars after its IPO underwriters launch coverage with bullish ratings....

    Synacor (SYNC +16.3%) soars after its IPO underwriters launch coverage with bullish ratings. Citi claims the provider of online video software for ISPs is well-protected from technology risk due to strong customer loyalty, and the rollout of TV Everywhere and mobile streaming initiatives. Oppenheimer argues the addition of new customers such as Toshiba and Verizon will drive near-term growth. (last week)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • SEED

    Shares of China-based seed producer Origin Agritech (SEED +44.8%) soar after investment firm...

    Shares of China-based seed producer Origin Agritech (SEED +44.8%) soar after investment firm Monness Crespi Hardt says the company seems to be the closest to securing approval of the Chinese government for the first genetically modified seed in that country. The firm views potential approval as a positive but notes there is no exact time frame and that approval could be delayed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • AGN

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +0.8%) bounces around violently after word leaks that the company is...

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +0.8%) bounces around violently after word leaks that the company is close to signing off on a deal to buy Icelandic firm Actavis for €5B-€5.5B. Shares dropped sharply off the news, then reversed themselves in a slingshot move higher, and now stand +0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • LLEN

    L&L Energy (LLEN +11.8%) says it signed an agreement with the logistics arm of AVIC...

    L&L Energy (LLEN +11.8%) says it signed an agreement with the logistics arm of AVIC International, China's largest state-owned aviation company, to expand its coal sales throughout China's Guizhou province, where the company has been concentrating significant efforts in recent months.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • TAOM

    Chinese children's media site Taomee (TAOM -7.8%) slips despite beating Q4 estimates late...

    Chinese children's media site Taomee (TAOM -7.8%) slips despite beating Q4 estimates late yesterday. Revenue and profits declined y/y, as the company continues to de-emphasize monetization over the near term to rejuvenate growth and enhance user stickiness. The company also lowers guidance below Street estimates. Stifel Nicolaus cuts the shares to Hold on the back of the results.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • YGE

    Chinese solar stocks sink as NYT notes the impact of smaller-than-expected tariffs on the market...

    Chinese solar stocks sink as NYT notes the impact of smaller-than-expected tariffs on the market "could be limited" but tariffs could be added in May when the Commerce Department will consider whether China is dumping solar panels in the U.S. YGE -12.5%, TSL -7.8%, STP -9.8%, JASO -6.3%. U.S. solar shares also are lower: FSLR -5.9%, SPWR -6.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • HPQ

    Investors and analysts yawn at H-P's (HPQ -2%) PC-printer reorg. Brean Murray is concerned about...

    Investors and analysts yawn at H-P's (HPQ -2%) PC-printer reorg. Brean Murray is concerned about the impact on sales, and Mizuho says that while the move may pay off eventually, it increases near-term uncertainty and raises execution risk; also, H-P “has yet to outline its vision on how it plans to tackle the secular headwinds facing the printing industry."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • ARIA

    Jefferies keeps the faith on Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +4.3%) despite the FDA slam of the...

    Jefferies keeps the faith on Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +4.3%) despite the FDA slam of the firm's sarcoma drug. Analysts reiterate a Buy rating and $17 price target on Ariad, as they note the company's valuation is tied closer to the success of Ponatinib than Taltorvic.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • SLAB

    Silicon Labs (SLAB +2%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at UBS, saying its new CEO will...

    Silicon Labs (SLAB +2%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at UBS, saying its new CEO will refine its growth strategy and improve R&D efficiency in order to drive operating leverage. The firm also raises its price target to $50 from $48.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • AGO

    Assured Guaranty (AGO -15.6%) says it was surprised by Moody's decision to put it on watch for a...

    Assured Guaranty (AGO -15.6%) says it was surprised by Moody's decision to put it on watch for a potential downgrade. The credit rater yesterday placed AGO's Aa3 ratings and its insurance operating companies on review, citing significant exposure to sectors weakened by the financial crisis as well as more constrained business opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • BHGE

    Global Hunter Securities cuts Baker Hughes (BHI -4.6% to $45.60) to Neutral from Accumulate and...

    Global Hunter Securities cuts Baker Hughes (BHI -4.6% to $45.60) to Neutral from Accumulate and slashes its price target to $40 from $60 following the firm's profit warning. Global Hunter is also unhappy about "the lack of visibility as to when international will rebound and how BHI-specific NAM issues will be resolved."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • VTG

    Vantage Drilling (VTG +5.6%) trades higher after the company agrees to acquire the rights for...

    Vantage Drilling (VTG +5.6%) trades higher after the company agrees to acquire the rights for the ultra-deepwater drillship known as Dragonquest for $164M. After delivery, Dragonquest is expected to be used in the Gulf of Mexico, pursuant to a 8-year contract with Petrobras.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • LGF.A

    Box office reports tip off that Lions Gate's (LGF +4.1%) The Hunger Games has already set a box...

    Box office reports tip off that Lions Gate's (LGF +4.1%) The Hunger Games has already set a box office record for advance ticket purchases for a non-sequel movie.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • USG

    USG gains 10% after announcing it posted sales of $516.9M (+15.7% Y/Y) and a net loss of $30.5M...

    USG gains 10% after announcing it posted sales of $516.9M (+15.7% Y/Y) and a net loss of $30.5M in January and February; the Street is currently expecting just 9.6% revenue growth for the March quarter. USG attributes the strong results to increases in the average selling price and gross margin for its wallboard products, following a recent price hike.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • GMCR

    Investors of Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) breathe a sigh of relief, as the company and...

    Investors of Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) breathe a sigh of relief, as the company and Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) announce an expansion of their strategic relationship for the manufacturing, marketing, distribution and sale of Starbucks-branded Vue packs for use in GMCR's recently introduced Keurig Vue Brewer. GMCR +7.8%, SBUX +0.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • ASGN

    Premarket gainers: ASGN +25%. FSII +15%. USG +13%. YPF +9%. HIG +7%. LNKD +6%. CVM +6%. LXRX...

    Premarket gainers: ASGN +25%. FSII +15%. USG +13%. YPF +9%. HIG +7%. LNKD +6%. CVM +6%. LXRX +5%. LGF +3%.
    Losers: AGO -10%. BHI -4%. ZLCS -3%. STP -3%. PHG -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • CXS

    Specialty finance company Crexus Investment (NYSE:CXS) -7.4% premarket after declaring a Q1...

    Specialty finance company Crexus Investment (NYSE:CXS) -7.4% premarket after declaring a Q1 common stock cash dividend of $0.27/share, down from a prior $0.35. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • MU

    Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU) has offered $1.5B to acquire Japan-based DRAM maker Elpida Memory,...

    Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU) has offered $1.5B to acquire Japan-based DRAM maker Elpida Memory, according to DigiTimes. Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSBF) and Globalfoundries reportedly are also among likely bidders for Elpida, which filed for bankruptcy in February. MU +1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM
  • YPF

    Argentina's YPF +10.9% premarket following reports the government will not nationalize the...

    Argentina's YPF +10.9% premarket following reports the government will not nationalize the country's biggest energy company, and that it only wants YPF to boost production. Argentina's president had criticized YPF for not investing enough money in the country, and nationalization concerns grew.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 2 Comments

  • Hartford shares +5.9% after it gives in to the demands of John Paulson, it's biggeset...

    Hartford shares +5.9% after it gives in to the demands of John Paulson, it's biggeset shareholder, to sell its insurance-related operations and exit its annuity business. In a February earnings call, Paulson had screamed at management to do something "drastic" to improve Hartford's industry-low valuations.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • OPEN

    Benchmark upgrades Open Table (NASDAQ:OPEN) to Buy from Hold, as it cites the firm's superior...

    Benchmark upgrades Open Table (NASDAQ:OPEN) to Buy from Hold, as it cites the firm's superior growth and competitive position. Analysts say that concerns over competition is overblown, pointing out it took OpenTable 10 years to land a 44% penetration rate in restaurants. Shares +3.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes (BHI) warns its pretax op profit will fall on a quarterly basis in Q1, with the N....

    Baker Hughes (BHI) warns its pretax op profit will fall on a quarterly basis in Q1, with the N. American margin set to drop to 13.2%-14.2% from 18.7% in Q4, and that for its international ops to decline to 12.2%-13.2% from 15.6%. A major reason is the "rapidly changing market conditions in the Pressure Pumping product line." Shares plunge 4.3%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM
  • MSFT

    Goldman Sachs upgrades LinkedIn (LNKD) to a Buy rating after channel checks show increasing user...

    Goldman Sachs upgrades LinkedIn (LNKD) to a Buy rating after channel checks show increasing user engagement and positive hiring solutions trends. Analysts with Goldman set a $135 price target on LNKD - repping 47% upside potential. Shares +3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • PCRFY

    Panasonic (PC) plans to close a California plant that makes silicon wafers for solar cells,...

    Panasonic (PC) plans to close a California plant that makes silicon wafers for solar cells, according to a report in the Nikkei business daily. Shares -2.2% in Tokyo.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 AM
